titleStmt.title: An answer to the maiden's tragedy: or, The lamentation of a young man, near Wolverhampton, for the death of a young maiden; which of late has been a great grief and trouble to him, for his unkindness to her. To the tune of, Russel's farewel.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for P. Brooksby, J. Deacon, J. Blare, and J. Back.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "You lovers are both far and near ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
